basics.name: Jina (Yong Jin) Chun
basics.label: Applied Scientist
basics.summary: Ph.D. student in Software Engineering at UC Irvine focused on advancing software engineering through Large Language Models (LLMs), Natural Language Processing (NLP), and multi-agent systems.

work experiences.name: University of California, Irvine
work experiences.summary: Teaching Undergrad and Graduate level Software Engineering courses.

work experiences.name: University of California, Irvine
work experiences.summary: Conducting research under Professor Iftekhar Ahmed on LLMs and multi-agent systems.

student mentoring.summary: Mentored undergraduate students through UC Irvine's GIC program.

education.summary: Graduated Cum Laude. Dean’s Honor List.

professional service.title: Reviewer, ACM Transactions on Software Engineering and Methodology (TOSEM)

publications.name: Unveiling Creativity in Software Engineering Discussions: An Empirical Study
publications.summary: An empirical study discovering creativity in discussions among software engineers working on open-source projects. Related to NLP and LLM. On-going.

publications.name: Multi-Agent Debate for Software Engineering: An Empirical Study
publications.summary: Adapted a multi-agent debate framework for code summarization and translation, enabling AI agents to collaboratively perform software engineering tasks. Related to Multi-Agent Systems.

Undergraduate Student Mentoring.summary: Mentoring Dingyi Chang and Keanu Jahncke since July 2023.
